message.content:
1. Start by writing down the various working hours (in terms of start and end times) for each employee in a table format. You can use Excel or any other tool you're comfortable with.

2. To calculate total worked hours, subtract the starting time from the ending time for each employee on a daily basis.

3. After calculating work hours for all employees, sum up their individual totals to get the combined number of man-hours worked per day or week, depending on your requirement.

4. Review the data regularly and ensure accuracy by cross-checking with attendance records or verifying against any installed software that tracks employees' logged-in time.

5. If possible, automate this process using specific tools and save it in an easy-to-analyze format like charts or graphs, making it easier to visualize patterns over time regarding productivity among teams members.

6. Keep track of overtime as well if there is any significant amount involved; make sure employees receive adequate compensation according to labor laws applicable in your region/country.

7.elements TimeTracking systems will provide detail reports based on which managers may analyze which staff perform better at certain periods within a given timeframe allowing them greater insight into optimizing workforce strengths while also identifying areas needing improvement where one-on-one coaching might be beneficial resulting increased overall efficiency organization-wide thus leading toward achieving business objectives more effectively efficiently streamlining costs associated workers performing duties required maintaining company profitability growth goals standards compliance guidelines regulations industry best practices quality assurance expectations customer satisfaction guarantees future success return investment (ROI).
